content: fibrefest 2023 crocheted bag it s the year of the hexies for the last 6 months i ve been teaching how to sew small hexagonal fabric patches and there are a lot of quilts using hexies so i m forever making up new patterns it was this that gave me the idea for a cro- chet bag using hexagonal pieces the brief was simple crochet that most could do nice yarn and an easy to follow pattern and i be- lieve i ve done that the joy of this pattern is you can make it smaller if you want the 7 hexies are crocheted together then a simple border added and a pair of store-bought handles sewn on these can be obtained at craft shops or ebay or crochet your own i have lined this bag although it s not really neces- sary i just enjoy that extra bit of colour just make sure that the gauge is firm so then it will hold its shape i ve used noro silk garden it s a mixture of silk mo- hair & wool it took 5 balls which i had in my stash plus a small amount of black yarn to crochet togeth- er the noro yarn is equal to a thick 8 ply so there are heaps of different yarns that can be used i think variegated yarns would be good as it adds that colour variation any yarn can be used as it doesn t matter if the size is slightly different i then raided my old necklaces in my bead box & found some lovely turquoise beads & a concho button for the centre diane scaysbrook abbreviations materials required chain = chain 5 x balls of noro silk garden yarn total is double_crochet = double_crochet 250 grams 500 mts treble_crochet = treble 50g of plain yarn for joining & top edging slip_stitch = slip_stitch 3mm or 3 5mm hook depending on your gauge i used 3 5mm needs to be firm beads for decoration © di scaysbrook 2023 fibrefest 2023 - crocheted bag pattern is written using english crochet terms every round starts with a 3 chain which counts as the 1st treble & every round finishes with a slip_stitch into the 3 cid 484 cid 470 chain of the first pretend treble this pattern is a bit like a granny square but has 6 corners & each hexie is 24cm wide at the widest part point to point make 7 hexies chain 4 & join with a slip_stitch or do a magic loop round 1 3 chain counted as 1st treble_crochet 11 treble_crochet into ring join with a slip_stitch into 3 cid 484 cid 470 chain 12 treble_crochet round 2 slip_stitch into space between trebles 3 chain counted as 1st treble_crochet 1 treble_crochet into same space continue around circle doing 2 treble_crochet into each space join with a slip_stitch into 3 cid 484 cid 470 chain 24 treble_crochet round 3 do 2 slip_stitch across the 2 treble_crochet
